As Night Shift had been fibbing to Hydras and the others, he manages to sen=
d a text message to Lord Elder to fowrward to Tucson when he had a free mom=
ent.  He uses a frequency only to be read and conveyed by Maximal and Autob=
ot kind.  

"Sorry for the late report, I'm at the fortress now.  I'm gonna=
 need a little more time for these goons ta trust me.  After that I'm hopn'=
 ta be able ta get a copy of that shell program for you guys.  Ya may not h=
ear from me for a while, gotta keep a low profile.  Tell Tucson Prime I'm d=
on' the best I can.  If I run inta trouble, I'll send a silent distress bea=
con.  I promise, I won't bite off more than I can chew.  These guys ain't t=
he type ta fool around...  Especially Cyclonus, who has just found out that=
 Tucson just got a serious upgrade.  Anyway, Night Shift out."

He breaks c=
ontact quickly, so is to keep his low profile.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.c=
om, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > " We all have to start=
 somewhere. It may not be where everyone expects. But the smallest of chang=
es can always lead to the best of results. Kup, Elita, Lord Elder, guard th=
e Ark. I'm going to head over to the Maximal Base, and I'm going to talk to=
 Nightstrike. I think if we start gradually, we'll get to where we need to =
be."
> >
> > He opens the door to the outside, and transforms into a larger=
 vehicle, with a sizeable trailer, looking a bit like a modern day truck.
>=
 >
> > "Inform me of Night Shift's progress as soon as he reports. Keep saf=
e my comrades."
> >
> > He slowly rolls off the ramp, stopping at the end, =
and signalling his next direction before rolling off to the Maximal base. H=
is speed is kept at a casual fifty five miles per hour.
> 
> Lord Elder loo=
ked at Kup and Elita for a moment as Tuscon . . . err .
> . Tuscon PRIME ro=
lled out of the Ark. "He's going to be a good Prime I
> think." Elder said =
to Kup, his voice a mixture of hope and confidence.
> "Even if he is a bit =
hasty."
> 
> Elder opened his communication link to Tuscon, "Um, sir? Night=
strike
> is not one of Hydras' people, he is a minion, so he belongs to
> U=
nicron."
> 
> Elder shrugged sheepishly as he closed the communication and =
looked at
> Kup, "I just thought he'd want to know that. He didn't really h=
ang
> around after he gave his orders."
> 
> (TAG)
